name: El Establo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were both pleased with El Establo - it's a beautiful place with an amazing view of the mountains and acres and acres of land. The hotel itself is HUGE, but we stayed in one of the buildings closer to reception, the restaurant, etc. The rooms themselves are well appointed - clean, neat, BIG bathrooms (which are not very well lit and also have small ventilation windows that go out into the hallway - meaning that you can hear people in the bathrooms as you walk by their rooms - a little odd), very comfortable. The hotel also has internet access (which you do have to pay for) pools, a spa, all kinds of stuff. We did a night tour with a guide that was only so-so and some of the staff (aside from the reception staff) were a little rude to us, but all in all it was a positive experience. They also had a nice breakfast in the morning and a "happy hour" that was sparsely attended, but still fun for us. From what I have heard, in a town of backpacker hotels and eco-lodges, this is by far the most luxurious of them all - so if you want luxury while experiencing the beautiful Cloud Forest, this is the place to stay!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Terrific hotel on the side of a mountain. Great rooms with many attractions on site. Disappointed in the restaurant however. And there was no bar during our stay as the upscale restaurant was closed. Try to eat elsewhere.
reviews.title: Among the better hotels in the area but did not meet expections

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at El Establo for three nights in November. Since we went during the low-season, the hotel was almost empty. We had a two-level room with a king bed on the main level and another in the loft. Amazing views from our balcony!!! The restaurant was mediocre at best. We usually walked or took a taxi into the town for lunch and dinner.
reviews.title: Great views but so-so service and food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is right niext to the cloud forest. Staff is helpful, breakfast is delicious, grounds feature natural beauty of the area.
reviews.title: Great facilities, food & location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our honeymoon started out with a 3 night stay at El Establo and we couldn't have been more pleased. We were told it was the nicest hotel in Monteverde and we were not disappointed. The hotel is set into the side of a mountain in the cloud forrest. The views from our room were truely amazing. We were lucky enough to have 2 partially clear days and could see the gulf of Nicoya from our deck.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting in the cloud forest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel after coming from a 2-star hotel near the beach, and I was thrilled with the accomodations. It is a more expensive hotel, but we got a pretty decent rate on Expedia. The views were absolutely breathtaking, and the bed was very comfortable. A few large insects made their way into the room, but its Monteverde, so I did expect that somewhat. Service was also great, we booked our excursion through the hotel (Extremos ziplining, so much fun). Breakfast buffet was delicious.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend the spa - I got a great package deal for $100. Ask them for their specials when you arrive.
reviews.title: Great Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My husband stayed here after staying in a cabina in Montezuma and felt like we were in paradise. It did feel a bit un-Monteverde but we really enjoyed the big and luxurious room and large windows views. The breakfast buffets were very good with many items to choose from but requires that you wear an annoying wrist band to show that you are a guest the entire stay. The grounds are spread out up the hillside and some rooms will require a shuttle from the lobby. The hotel has its own trails and canopy tours it you don't want to go too far. This is not a cheap place but our stay was comfortable and made for a good pit stop to get our energy back.
reviews.title: Amazing view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at this hotel in July. We had an amazing view of Lake Arenal from our room. Friendly staff, great room and good (free) breakfast as well.
reviews.title: El Establo-Unfriendly and Rude Staff-Insects/Animal Feces in/around Pools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was rude, all around, especially the assistant manager, Raquel Castro, who was most condescending and disinterested in our concerns. Moments after we arrived in our room, our door was opened (no knock) by totally non-English speaking housekeeping staff indicating that they wanted to clean our room. I tried to explain that we had just arrived, and they walked away, seeming not to understand.
reviews.title: Great Spot in the Mountains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as part of a package tip to Costa Rica. The hotel was everything we expected. The rooms are huge, with two queen size beds, a balcony with view over the valley (when the fog gives you a break ;) ) and it has a very quiet and relaxing feel to it.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is also very nice, with a lot of variety and good quality. Just remenber to ask for a room in the lower room blocks, has it is near the reception and restaurant. The hotel is huge, with the higher blocks being a great distance from the restaurant. There are hotel vans that will take you anywhere you like within the hotel but in the higher blocks you are dependant on them and have to call them and wait every time.
reviews.title: a gem and very beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: One afternoon we asked them to take us to the highest point and it was a good walk down, watching the view and getting to know the rest of the hotel. Walking up the hill wouldn't have been so fun :)
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but be prepared to climb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Bottom line, this is a very nice hotel to stay at.
reviews.title: Only positive was the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one nite, wish I could have stayed longer. The property was so beutiful and very clean, the food was average, and the area was not that bad. I really enjoyed my short stay here, The only down fall was the road up here was very bad and tiredsome, but once you reach the property you forget about the ride and focus on the view which is by the way very beutiful. My room was in the 500 building with the view of the cloud forest. I love the decor and the two rocking chairs that were in the room were confortable. I will stay here again the hospitality was great and they do go out of their way to make sure that you are pleased.
reviews.title: Nicest of the Monteverde hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think this is one of the nicer hotels in the area but its not saying much. The one thing I liked about the hotel is that it is situated high up and the rooms are on different levels of land which make for great views. Beyond that, the rooms need renovating, the pool is not so nice and cold. Don't bother with room service, there are plenty of resturants in walking distance, go even if you you don't feel like going out. The breakfast is plentiful but crowded with families. We stayed 2 nights which was just right if you want to visit monte verde.
reviews.title: Just OK...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the El Stablo in July. Hotel was not crowded estimate less than 20%. We were automatically upgraded on check-in to two level suite with 2 king beds. Rooms were clean with view of town, there were some bugs on window, had sliding glass door to balcony without screen. The rooms had lots of windows and in Am let light in. This was ok as morning activities planned. Also, not a lot of insulation between rooms and hall (bathroom vent to hall) so heard hall noise at night. The resort has 2 swimming pools, tennis court, spa and walking trails with zip lines (lots of activities and buildings). There is a shuttle bus available to take you around. The resort was empty. Wife and daughter used the spa and had excellent massage and seaweed bath for a decent price. The morning buffet breakfast (included in room rate) was ok (not the best food and no omelette station). The breakfast food may have been a reflection of the low occupancy. Even though the hotel was empty, the front desk hassled us about late check out. Definitely bring raincoat as rains a lot. Check out the Monteverde Cloud Forrest while there, as we did AM guided tour ($34 pp including park feee arranged at park) – was very good (Roberto Wesson – mwesson@yahoo.com). Had dinner at Sophia’s cross the street and down a block was excellent. Also, wife and daughter did Selvature Canopy Tours had a blast (picked and dropped off at hotel). Whole town was empty as tourism is down . Check out German Bakery in Santa Elena. Roads to Monteverde kind of challenge – steep and dirt; I would not try at night as occasional cattle and no guard rails with big drop offs – SUV needed. Internet down while there. Check out the cheese factory. SUV helpful to get around.
reviews.title: Nice lots of Activities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: It´s a beautiful hotel, every quiet and calm... they have gorgeous rooms with a great view.
reviews.title: Best trip I´ve had in years... Everything was just perfect...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In El Establo you can get the best costumer service ever... their staff treat me and my family like kings...
reviews.title: The Best Hotel Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nothing you can´t do staying in this hotel... you can rest, have delicious meals, make some excersise, you can practice canopy, go to marvellous sky walking, you name it and they´ll get it or do it for you...
reviews.title: Would never stay here again - a mistake

description: Nestled in the misty cloud forest of Monteverde, El Establo offers the best quality services that will make your trip an unforgettable experience: The area`s best view, heated indoor pools, spa, restaurants, café-bars, special events center, internet access, souvenirs shop, tennis court, basketball court, mini soccer court, hiking trails, canopy tour and the most charming staff. This half Costarican – half Quaker, family owned hotel, will allow you to share the best of both cultures.
